clinical_study.brief_title: Neutrino Regimen for Treatment-experienced HCV GT1 Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy and Safety of Neutrino Therapy for Chronic HCV Genotype 1b Treatment-experienced Patients

brief_summary.textblock: This study will evaluate the efficacy and safety of NEUTRINO regimen in Chinese chronic HCV genotype 1b treatment-experienced patients.

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of participants with sustained virologic response 12 weeks after discontinuation of therapy (SVR12)
primary_outcome.description: SVR12 is defined as HCV RNA < lower limit of quantification (LLOQ) 12 weeks after last dose of study drug.

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of participants with adverse events leading to permanent discontinuation of study drug(s)
primary_outcome.description: Adverse events leading to permanent discontinuation of study drug(s)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in HCV RNA From Baseline to Week 12
Proportion of participants with on-treatment virologic breakthrough and relapse

arm_group.description: Participants with HCV genotype 1b infection will receive Sofosbuvir (SOF) 400 mg +PEG+RBV for 12 weeks.

intervention.description: Sofosbuvir (SOF) 400 mg tablet is administered orally once daily; Pegylated interferon alfa-2a (PEG) 180 μg was administered once weekly by subcutaneous injection; Ribavirin (RBV) was administered as a tablet orally according to body weight (< 75kg = 1000 mg and ≥ 75 kg = 1200 mg).
